case_study.name: Case Study (CS)
case_study.description: A case study assessment allows candidates to demonstrate their mastery of security risk analysis through real-world scenarios.
case_study.focus: The case study assessment focuses on providing authentic evidence of candidates' ability to assess and address security risks effectively.
tasks: Candidates will analyze a case study involving security threats and propose appropriate risk management strategies.

evidence.LO1: Candidates will identify potential security threats based on provided scenarios.
evidence.LO2: Candidates will demonstrate the application of organizational procedures in risk identification.
evidence.LO3: Candidates will relate past experiences to analyze suspicious activities in the case study.
evidence.LO4: Candidates will collaborate with peers to assess risks and present findings.

submission: Candidates will submit a comprehensive report detailing their analysis and recommendations based on the case study.
case_study.retention_period: All submitted case study reports will be retained for 3 years for compliance and auditing purposes.

oral_questioning.name: Oral Questioning (OQ)
oral_questioning.description: Oral Questioning assessments allow candidates to demonstrate their understanding of security risk analysis concepts through verbal responses.

evidence.LO1: Candidates will verbally identify tell-tale signs of security threats.
evidence.LO2: Candidates will explain organizational procedures for risk identification.
evidence.LO3: Candidates will discuss their analysis of suspicious activities based on prior experiences.
evidence.LO4: Candidates will articulate their collaborative approach to risk assessment.

submission: Candidates will verbally respond to assessors during a structured questioning session.
oral_questioning.retention_period: All oral questioning recordings and assessment notes will be retained for 2 years for compliance and auditing.
